item.title: Sheila add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "I wish friends held hands more often, like the children I see on the streets sometimes. I'm not sure why we have to grow up and get embarrassed about it." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Sheila add a quote by Craig Ferguson
item.description: "That's why I believe in a Constitution which separates church from state. I've seen what happens when they get in cahoots." -- Craig Ferguson

item.title: Sheila add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sheila add a quote by Sarah Caudwell
item.description: "...it seems to us that the readers who want fiction to be like life are considerably outnumbered by those who would like life to be like fiction." -- Sarah Caudwell

item.title: Sheila add a quote by Djuna Barnes
item.description: "A man's sorrow runs uphill; true it is difficult for him to bear, but it is also difficult for him to keep." -- Djuna Barnes

item.title: Sheila add a quote by Djuna Barnes
item.description: "From the half-open doors of this chiffonier hung laces, ribands, stockings, ladies' underclothing and an abdominal brace, which gave the impression that the feminine finery had suffered venery." -- Djuna Barnes

item.title: Sheila add a quote by Djuna Barnes
item.description: "Oh," he cried. "A broken heart have you! I have falling arches, flying dandruff, a floating kidney, shattered nerves <i>and</i> a broken heart!" -- Djuna Barnes

item.title: Sheila add a quote by Erik Larson
item.description: "I will be on the look out for you, my dear girl," he wrote. "You must expect to give yourself up when you come." For this buttoned-up age, for Burnham, it was a letter that could have steamed itself open." -- Erik Larson

item.title: Sheila add a quote by Erik Larson
item.description: "At present," he said, "I am responsible for conveying my associates to a place called Chicago. I understand it is somewhere in the hinterland." -- Erik Larson

item.title: Sheila add a quote by Erik Larson
item.description: "At one point during the Holmes investigation Chicago's chief of police told a <i>Tribune</i> reporter he'd just as soon have a squad of reporters under his command as detectives." -- Erik Larson

item.title: Sheila add a quote by Patrick Rothfuss
item.description: "The truth is that the world is full of dragons, and none of us are as powerful or cool as we’d like to be. And that sucks. But when you’re confronted with that fact, you can either crawl into a hole and quit, or you can get out there, take off your shoes, and Bilbo it up." -- Patrick Rothfuss

item.title: Sheila add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better." -- Doris Lessing
